thread.title: Former Auburn assistant J.B. Grimes joins Rhett Lashlee at UConn
thread.title_full: Former Auburn assistant J.B. Grimes joins Rhett Lashlee at UConn

title: Former Auburn assistant J.B. Grimes joins Rhett Lashlee at UConn
text:
Slot to Auburn Links 
Former Auburn offensive line coach J.B. Grimes will serve as the offensive line coach at UConn next season, a source familiar with the decision tells AuburnUndercover. 
Grimes served as Auburn's offensive line coach from 2013 through 2015. His offensive lines consistently ranked as some of the best in the country and paved the way for the SEC's first offense to lead the nation in rushing (328.3 yards per game in 2013). Grimes coached NFL Draft picks Greg Robinson and Shon Coleman . Center Reese Dismukes also won the Rimington Trophy during his three-year tenure with the Tigers. *** Get free breaking news in the Auburn Undercover newsletter *** Grimes left Auburn following the 2015 season to coach under former Auburn coach Tommy Tuberville at Cincinnati, where the Bears fired Tuberville following this season. Grimes served one season on Cincinnati's staff. News of Grimes' hiring at UConn was first reported by James Crepea of AL.com. 
Grimes joins Rhett Lashlee , the Auburn offensive coordinator who left for the same position at UConn on Wednesday.
